revised_title: Observations on the Solar Spots and Their Variations
tldr: The author, William Derham, provides detailed observations and descriptions of sunspots and their variations over time. He also discusses the use of a newly invented micrometer and a half-second watch to measure the spots' positions and distances from the sun's limb. Although the spots have disappeared, Derham hopes that his work may serve as a foundation for more accurate accounts of solar phenomena by others.
